items.title: Exercise 1: Variance Analysis Report (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Q3 Administrative Budget Review

Summary Table:
- Item: Office Stationery | Budget: £500 | Actual: £850 | Variance: +£350 (Overspend)
- Item: Software Subscriptions | Budget: £1,200 | Actual: £1,100 | Variance: -£100 (Underspend)
- Item: Staff Training | Budget: £3,000 | Actual: £500 | Variance: -£2,500 (Significant Underspend)

Notes:
- The overspend in stationery was due to the unexpected bulk purchase of ergonomic chairs (CAPEX incorrectly logged as OPEX).
- The underspend in training is a major concern. I wish we had started the leadership program in July as planned. If only the vendor had confirmed the dates sooner, we would have been on track.
- We must justify the stationery overspend to the Finance Director by Friday.

questions.question: Why was there an overspend in the 'Office Stationery' category?
options: Ergonomic chairs were incorrectly logged as OPEX
questions.explanation: Doc A explains the overspend was due to chairs being logged incorrectly as OPEX.

questions.question: What does the writer regret regarding staff training?
options: Not starting the leadership program in July
questions.explanation: The writer says: 'I wish we had started the leadership program in July as planned.'

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Budgeting Concepts. Which term refers to day-to-day operational costs like rent and utilities?
items.explanation: OPEX (Operating Expenses) covers the ongoing costs of running a business.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Variance Analysis. If your budget was £1,000 and you spent £1,200, what is the variance?
items.explanation: Spending more than the budget results in an overspend (variance of +£200).

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Operational Chunks. Complete the sentence: 'We need to ___ the spend on the new hardware before we can ___ the funds.'
items.explanation: In a professional context, you 'justify the spend' and then 'allocate the funds'.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Present Wishes. Use 'I wish' to express a desire for more staff in your department (currently you are understaffed).
items.modelAnswer: I wish we had more staff in our department.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: Past Regrets. Use 'If only' to express regret that you didn't book the flights when they were cheaper last month.
items.modelAnswer: If only I had booked the flights when they were cheaper last month.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Data. Based on Doc A, identify which items were underspent and which were overspent.
items.modelAnswer: Overspent: Office Stationery. Underspent: Software Subscriptions, Staff Training.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. How would you professionally ask a vendor for a discount on a large order?
options: Make it cheaper or I won't buy.
Would you be able to offer a volume discount if we increase the order size?
items.explanation: This is a polite and professional way to negotiate a discount.

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Funding Request Email. Write a short email (50-75 words) to your manager requesting additional funding for a new software license. Mention that the current budget is exhausted.
items.modelAnswer: Hi Mark, I’m writing to request additional funding for the Adobe Creative Cloud license. Our current OPEX budget for software is unfortunately exhausted due to the unexpected price increase last month. I wish we had forecasted this earlier, but the license is essential for the marketing team to meet their Q4 deadlines. Could we allocate some of the underspend from the travel budget? Thanks, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Financial Ledger. Where are all financial accounts of a particular type collected?
items.explanation: A ledger is the collection of financial accounts.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Budget Review. Record a 2-minute audio explaining a budget variance to your team. Use 'I wish' or 'If only' to discuss a past mistake.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Clarity, Use of terms (OPEX, variance), Correct use of wishes/regrets.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Cost-Cutting Suggestion. Record a 60-second audio suggesting a way to cut costs in the office. Use 'I wish they would...' to complain politely about a current waste of money.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Professional suggestion, Use of 'I wish they would...', Polite tone.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Budget Justification Report (Portfolio). Draft a 150-word report justifying an overspend on 'IT Equipment' (CAPEX). Use wishes and regrets to explain why the initial budget was insufficient.
items.modelAnswer:
Budget Justification: IT Equipment Overspend

During Q3, the IT Equipment budget was exceeded by 15%. This overspend occurred because we had to replace five laptops that were damaged during the office flood. 

I wish we had known about the risk of flooding in the basement storage area earlier. If only we had invested in waterproof cabinets last year, this cost could have been avoided. However, the laptops were essential to maintain BAU for the support team.

To compensate for this overspend, we have identified an underspend in 'Office Events' which we propose to reallocate. Moving forward, I wish management would approve a small 'contingency fund' for such emergencies. We will also ensure all future equipment purchases are correctly logged as CAPEX rather than OPEX.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: Expense Tracking Template. Complete an expense entry for a 'New Office Printer'. Include: Date, Category (OPEX/CAPEX), Amount, and Justification.
items.modelAnswer: Date: 14th March. Category: CAPEX. Amount: £450. Justification: Replacement of broken printer in the HR department.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) Define CAPEX. 2) What is 'Variance Analysis'? 3) Complete: 'I wish we ___ (buy) the software last week.' 4) What is the difference between an overspend and an underspend?
items.modelAnswer: 1) Capital Expenditure for assets. 2) Comparing budget vs actual spend. 3) ...had bought... 4) Overspend is spending more than budget; underspend is spending less.
